content.description: Let <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of randomly selected adults in a community surveyed to find someone with a certain genetic trait.
content.question: The random variable <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a geometric distribution with mean 4.66. Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the mean?

choices.label: A value randomly selected from the distribution of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is expected to be 4.66.
In repeated sampling from the distribution of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the average of the values will approach 4.66.

For a sample of values randomly selected from the distribution of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the average of the sample will be 4.66.

The probability is 0.66 that a value randomly selected from the distribution of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be close to the mean.

For a sample of values randomly selected from the distribution of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the average of the sample will vary from the population mean by no more than 4.66.

content.answer: In repeated sampling from the distribution of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the average of the values will approach 4.66.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
